metadata.Title: CVE-2023-23004 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.19, drivers/gpu/drm/arm/malidp_planes.cmisinterprets the get_sg_table return value (expects it to be NULL in theerror case, whereas it is actually an error pointer).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23004` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-79-generic - 5.15.0-79.86
linux-image-5.15.0-79-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-79.86
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-79-generic - 5.15.0-79.86
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-79-generic-64k - 5.15.0-79.86
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-28-generic - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-28-generic-64k - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-79.86').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1').
